channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Historic all-civilian space flight splashes down off Florida coast
item.description: • Rare photos show the early years of NASA's space shuttle era

item.title: Australia's nuclear-powered submarine deal is fueling anger in the country
CNN correspondent: Recalling envoys a move 'reserved for adversaries, not for allies'
item.description: CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

item.title: Angry and afraid, Afghanistan's LGBTQ community say they're being hunted down
item.description: Growing up as a teenager in Afghanistan, Rabia Balkhi felt lucky.

item.title: Hundreds of anti-lockdown protesters clash with police in Australia
CIA warned civilians were present seconds before US missile killed 10
item.description: Just after the US military launched a Hellfire missile to stop a white Toyota Corolla it believed to be an imminent threat to US troops leading the evacuation at the Kabul airport, the CIA issued an urgent warning: Civilians were likely in the area, including possibly children inside the vehicle, according to three sources familiar with the situation.

item.title: 'They didn't betray us yet,' says stranded Afghan ally with enduring hope of US rescue
item.description: Wakil's eyes fill with tears. He has no idea whether he and his family will get out of Afghanistan, and fears that if they don't the Taliban will hunt him down and kill him.

item.title: Taliban deny claims girls will be banned from school -- but don't say when they'll be allowed in
item.description: The Taliban have denied claims that Afghan women would be banned from secondary schools after calling on boys, but not girls, to resume education, claiming they needed to set up a "secure transportation system" for female students before allowing them back into classrooms.

item.title: This boy is concerned about the vaccine. Dr. Gupta explains why it's important
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta took on one of the hardest interviews, taking questions from children. He met with elementary students in Atlanta to answer their questions about Covid-19 and how to stay safe. They spoke outside in masks in compliance with school policy.

item.title: The planet is on a 'catastrophic' global warming path, UN report shows
Vaccine boosters are on the horizon. But the unvaccinated remain the biggest obstacle
item.description: While more people are likely to be eligible for Covid-19 vaccine booster shots, the most glaring issue prolonging the pandemic is the large swath of unvaccinated people, who are filling up hospitals and dying from the persistent virus, officials and health experts said.

item.title: Search for Gabby Petito's fiancé Brian Laundrie focuses on Florida nature reserve
item.description: Along with the search for missing 22-year-old Gabby Petito, local and federal authorities in Florida are looking for Petito's fiance Brian Laundrie after his family told police they haven't seen him since Tuesday.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Robert Durst, millionaire who was focus of HBO documentary 'The Jinx,' found guilty
item.description: A Los Angeles jury found Robert Durst, the notorious subject of the HBO series "The Jinx," guilty of first-degree murder for the killing of his best friend, Susan Berman, more than 20 years ago.

item.title: FBI ramps up investigations of threats against election officials
item.description: The FBI has stepped up investigations of threats against election officials -- in some cases, reaching out for the first time in recent weeks to election supervisors and others who have endured months of harassment, local officials tell CNN.

item.title: 'Hotlanta' is even more sweltering in these neighborhoods due to a racist 20th Century policy
item.description: On a warm September afternoon, Mona Scott sat on the front porch while her home baked like an oven. As she ran a frozen water bottle across her forehead and arms, Scott told CNN her air conditioning broke 10 days earlier and had not yet been fixed.

item.title: High temperatures, wildfire smoke and drought: The politics of climate change in one California congressional district
item.description: The changing climate is everywhere Gustavo Carranza looks when he walks through his undulating citrus farm here in this tiny town in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada.

item.title: The Murdaugh family saga: a tangled web of secrets and murder
item.description: A powerful family. A deadly boating accident. Two mysterious slayings. Drug addiction, stolen money and a botched shooting in an alleged insurance fraud scheme.

item.title: Chile, Fiji and South Africa are ready for travelers to come back
item.description: There have been mixed fortunes for the world's island communities this week, as some have restricted entry due to Covid surges while others are making plans for reopening.

item.title: The world's tallest nation is getting shorter
item.description: The Netherlands has long been the world's tallest nation -- but its people are getting shorter, according to Dutch researchers.

item.title: Italy will likely hold a referendum on decriminalizing cannabis next year
item.description: Italy will likely decide whether or not to decriminalize cannabis in a referendum next year, after campaign groups managed to gather the required 500,000 signatures in a week.

item.title: The UN General Assembly is about to start. Here's what to watch for
item.description: Coronavirus be damned, the world's diplomats are back.

item.title: Aerial video shows shocking reality at the Texas border
item.description: More than 9,500 migrants who have arrived at the US border in the past 48 hours are living under a bridge, and thousands more migrants are expected in the coming days. CNN's Rosa Flores reports.

item.title: How Biden hopes to recapture his momentum after a week of unexpected setbacks
item.description: A politically weakened President Joe Biden is looking to spark a turnaround with a renewed focus on his domestic agenda after a month marred by a spike in Covid-19 cases and a messy withdrawal from Afghanistan.

item.title: Vietnam approves Cuba's Abdala vaccine as Delta variant outbreak continues
item.description: Vietnam has approved Cuba's Abdala vaccine for use against the coronavirus, the government said on Saturday, as the Southeast Asian country battles its worst outbreak of the pandemic.

item.title: Trump abandoned this giant trade deal. Now, China wants in
item.description: China has applied to join a major Asia-Pacific trade partnership that the United States ditched several years ago, as the world's second largest economy tries to bolster its relationships in the region.

item.title: Two of Queen Elizabeth's sons are facing growing pressure
'The Mad Women's Ball' explores a dark era of medical history
item.description: It's a tale as old as time: A woman won't conform to societal norms, traditional notions of femininity or what's expected of her, and is dismissed as diseased. She's considered hysterical. And, as such, she is locked up, burned at the stake, hidden away or placed under the supposedly steadier control of men.

item.title: Feds say man driven by hatred of Jews pleaded guilty to all charges after deadly 2019 assault on California synagogue
item.description: A Southern Californian man who previously pleaded guilty to state murder and attempted murder charges following a 2019 attack on a synagogue in San Diego pleaded guilty Friday to federal hate crime charges, according to the Justice Department.

item.title: 'Go get that mouse!': CNN interview gets purr-fect interruption
item.description: CNN's Bianca Nobilo received a surprise visit from a feline friend while interviewing Speaker of the UK House of Commons, Sir Lindsay Hoyle.

item.title: A 9-year-old girl was raped and murdered in India. Her death is part of a bigger problem facing Dalit women
item.description: CNN spoke to several activists from Dalit Women Fight (DWF), which campaigns for the rights of women from their community. While Riya Singh and Mohini Bala are public about their work, the names of the other activists have been changed for their protection. This story is part of CNN's commitment to covering issues around identity, including race, gender, sexuality, religion, class and caste.

item.title: Bayern Munich puts seven goals past hapless VfL Bochum
item.description: When Bayern Munich is in this kind of mood, very few teams in world football can keep up. Unfortunately for VfL Bochum, Saturday was one of those days.

item.title: Wall Street Journal's Facebook Files series prompts comparisons to Big Tobacco
item.description: All week long, The Wall Street Journal's "Facebook Files" series has invited comparisons of the social media platform to tobacco companies.

item.title: Notre Dame cathedral in Paris will reopen in 2024, five years after disastrous fire
item.description: The Notre Dame cathedral is on track to reopen to the public in 2024 as the cathedral has now been entirely secured, two years after the disastrous fire that destroyed large parts of the 850-year-old building.

item.title: Winnie the Pooh's tree house for rent at this 'Bearbnb'
item.description: If your childhood dream was to live like Winnie the Pooh, this is your chance to make it come true by staying at a replica of the storied bear's tree house.

item.title: Tottenham to host world's first net zero carbon elite football game -- but is a carbon-neutral match possible?
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur hopes to end Sunday's Premier League game against Chelsea on zero -- not zero goals or shots on target, but zero carbon emissions.

item.title: Prince Philip's will to be kept secret for 90 years
item.description: The will of Prince Philip, the late husband of Britain's Queen Elizabeth, will be sealed and remain private for at least 90 years to preserve the monarch's dignity, a judge at London's High Court has ruled.

item.title: Japanese students sent a message in a bottle. 37 years later, it washed up in Hawaii
item.description: A glass bottle containing a message from 1984 has washed up in Hawaii and been discovered by a 9-year-old girl -- 37 years after high school students in Japan dropped it into the ocean as part of an experiment.

item.title: Walmart tests self-driving delivery cars
item.description: Walmart is testing a driverless car, in partnership with Ford and Argo AI, that delivers your order straight to your door. HLN's Elizabeth Prann reports.

item.title: Woolly mammoth resurrection project receives $15 million boost
item.description: We live in a time bookended by extremes.

item.title: Former Trump associate served lawsuit on live radio
item.description: Roger Stone, longtime associate of former President Donald Trump, was served a lawsuit involving January 6 during a live radio appearance on "Tomorrow's News Today."

item.title: Clive Sinclair, an inventor who helped popularize personal computers, dies at 81
item.description: Before computers were a staple of workplaces, schools, libraries and many homes, they were bulky, expensive and a luxury many couldn't afford.

item.title: Mother files complaint against school where she says students were segregated
item.description: CNN's Nick Valencia takes a closer look into a mother's claim that her children's school was assigning Black students to certain classes. The allegations have shaken up one Atlanta school community, with some parents insisting the principal would never group students based on race.

item.title: French aren't the only ones furious with Australia's new defense pact
item.description: • France recall of ambassadors may be a first in modern times, official says • Why France is angry about the US and UK giving Australia nuclear-powered submarines

item.title: One of Asia's most prestigious universities is on the frontline of a battle for democracy
Video of 4-year-old in hazmat suit without parents reveals human toll of zero-Covid policy
item.description: • Moderna's vaccine is the most effective: study

item.title: Earth is on a 'catastrophic' path
The 'world's safest city' for 2021 revealed
item.description: Safety has long been a paramount concern for travelers when it comes to deciding which destination to visit.

item.title: World's largest tree wrapped in foil to protect against nearby wildfires
item.description: The world's largest tree has been wrapped in foil to protect it against flames from an out-of-control fire burning in California's scenic Sequoia National Park.
